timeline.bodyText:
Ehm, that just disables leashing as a whole...
So noone would be able to leash anything anymore.
You would still need to check if someone used a grappling hook.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: Oh okok sorry I thought that you had isolated the event! Let me try it then ;)
replies.author: andrefpoliveira

replies.bodyText:
Nope, event isolation sadly isn't a thing in the Bukkit API XD
You'll still need to add manual checks for things
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: @TheBusyBiscuit just a question, the CI is saying that could not found PlayerLeashEntityEvent should I use another event?
replies.author: andrefpoliveira

replies.bodyText:
You imported it from the wrong namespace, that's why.
It's located in the org.bukkit.event.entity package.
Source: https://hub.spigotmc.org/javadocs/spigot/org/bukkit/event/entity/PlayerLeashEntityEvent.html
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: No need to cast a Player to a Player here.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: Oh right Sorry! It was the force of habbit from commands :) I will fix that and submit!
replies.author: andrefpoliveira
